meanings.definition: To make slightly wet or damp.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys moistening the plants in her garden every morning.
meanings.sent2: The rain is moistening the soil, helping the flowers grow.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy kept moistening the floor with its wet paws.
meanings.sent4: His tears were moistening the pages of the love letter he had written.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to a delicious cake is moistening the batter just right.

meanings.definition: The act of adding moisture to something.
meanings.sent1: The moistening of the skin with lotion helps keep it soft.
meanings.sent2: After the moistening of the clay, it was ready to be molded into a vase.
meanings.sent3: The sudden moistening of the air made her hair frizz up.
meanings.sent4: The moistening of the sponge made it easier to clean the dishes.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's job involves the careful moistening of the plants to keep them healthy.
